title: Japanese Tweeter explains perfect way to apply a Band Aid
text: comments The first aid box may be the go-to place for a minor wound but plasters almost always end up ragged, coming off or leaving a grey smudge on your finger. A Japanese Band-Aid fan may well have found the perfect way to ensure that the fabric dressing stays put and does its job. @ponzuyo posted a picture drawn diagram of how exactly to get the best fit from a plaster. Scroll down for video Seven steps to plaster heaven: The diagonal cutting technique has gone viral on the web Reach for the scissors: Even the simple band-aid has been subjected to a life hack The simple step-by-step hack involves cutting a plaster at both ends and then placing the strips of Band-Aid diagonally to ensure a snug fit on the injured finger. The plaster 'wrap' idea has since been pinballing across the internet, particularly in Japan, when Band-Aids are a source of cultural fascination. RELATED ARTICLES
